profile_data.summary: With a solid background in SoC functional validation at Intel Corporation, my focus has been on leading firmware/BIOS release executions and fostering collaborations with OEM/ODM customers for seamless integration with Intel Processors. My tenure here has been marked by a dedication to enhancing customer enablement through rigorous UEFI/BIOS validation and timely deliveries.
profile_data.headline: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

experience.description:
• Led execution for customer enablement, UEFI/BIOS validation, debug, and timely delivery of firmware/BIOS releases.
• Collaborated with OEM/ODM customers to integrate their BIOS in Intel firmware, ensuring seamless application running on Intel Processors.
• Worked closely with independent BIOS vendors and internal teams to integrate and test Intel firmware with their BIOS as part of Intel's shift left strategy.
experience.title: SoC Functional Validation Engineer

experience.description:
• Analyzed Intel’s Xeon server CPU’s high-volume manufacturing test data using Python scripting
• Developed ML algorithms to predict test results and root-cause failures
• Automated data analysis and visualizations for efficient decision-making
• Enhanced data-driven insights for optimizing manufacturing processes
experience.title: Graduate Technical Intern |Data Analytics and Machine Learning

experience.description:
Developed ML models in Python to predict semiconductor parameters for Physical design, achieving accurate results.

• Applied ML algorithms for defect identification and inverse design in semiconductors.
• Developing ML algorithms and models to predict various parameters of a semiconductor such as temperature, width of channel and work function using python for the experimental data provided
• Utilized Linear and polynomial regression methods to predict semiconductor parameters accurately.
experience.title: Research Assistant

experience.description:
• Developed applications on Salesforce platform using custom code (Apex and Visualforce) and integrated with external systems using REST and SOAP APIs.
• Utilized bug tracking, version control, and build systems like JIRA, Jenkins, and GIT.
• Worked in Agile and Scrum methodology to ensure efficient project delivery.
experience.title: Senior Project Engineer

experience.description:
Worked under the guidance of senior scientists in the Control Electronics division of ISRO.
Worked for the project which was designed to control the speed and position of servo actuator in the launch vehicle, which is based on a BLDC (Brush-less DC) motor and the whole system was implemented in FPGA.
experience.title: Intern

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description:
Participated in Kaggle's Covid19 forecasting series in Week 3, Week 4 and week5
The goal is to predict the confirmed cases and fatalities between April 15 and May 14 by region and also identify factors that appear to impact the transmission rate of COVID-19.
Developed various models for prediction which include Polynomial regression, Random Forest, and XGB regressor.
projects.title: COVID19 Global Forecasting| Forecast daily COVID-19 spread in regions around world

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description:
Developed different classification models to classify the stress levels using the WESAD dataset.
Seven different models were developed and compared the performance. The developed models include Logistic Regression, LDA, KNN, Random Forest, Decision Trees, Support Vector Machines. 
Initial models were fine-tuned to improve performance further. 
Used different feature extraction methods  and obtained optimized features. Outliers were also handled which improved the performance of each model.
projects.title: Stress detection and Classification using WESAD Data set

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description: In this project a subset of MIPS ISA (Instruction Set Architecture) is implemented in Verilog that can execute the dot product. The forward-chaining technique is also added. The MIPS instruction set is implemented, along with the initialization of Data and instruction Memory in Verilog. The pipelined processor has five stages and each stage is designated to do a task in one clock cycle. The goal of this project is to improve the performance of pipelined MIPS processor by incorporating the forward chaining technique
projects.title: Implementation of MIPS ISA DOT Product with Forward Chaining in Verilog

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description: Predicting vehicle angle in different settings for the autonomous driving system making use of computer vision, image recognition, object detection. Developed an algorithm to estimate the absolute pose of vehicles from a single image in a real-world traffic environment. The baseline model was built on CenterNet model which models an object as a single point which is the center point of a bounding box.  Implemented various regularization methods such as data augmentation, early stopping, image preprocessing technique, GCN, etc and tuned the various hyperparameters to improve the performance and reduce overfitting.
projects.title: Computer Vision| Autonomous Driving

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description: Implemented various deep neural networks to classify the 10 classes in the FASHION MNIST dataset and compared the performance of different fully-connected feedforward neural networks on the dataset. Implemented the project in Python using Scikit-Learn and Tensorflow. Each of the models was developed by varying the hyperparameters such as the number of hidden layers, number of neurons in each layer activation functions , epochs and batch size and observed the performance of each of the models using confusion matrix .
projects.title: Deep Learning | Classification of Fashion MNIST dataset

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description: Classification of Kannada digits using CNN in Keras using python. Implemented Convolutional Neural Networks for the image classification problem. Used various regularization techniques such as data augmentation, Dropout, Early Stopping, etc and obtained an accuracy of 98.6 in classifying the images in the dataset.
projects.title: Deep Learning | Kannada MNIST

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description:
The project was done in association with ISRO (Indian Space Research Organization), the space agency under Government of India, one of the world’s largest space agency.

The project was designed to control the speed and position of servo actuator in the launch vehicle, which is based on a BLDC motor and the implementation of the whole system in FPGA.
 The speed of the motor was controlled using PWM technique. The control circuit was based on a closed loop control technique where there is an inner loop for speed control and an outer loop for the position control of actuator. The position information provided by the hall sensors is compared against the given position command and the output is fed into an error amplifier.
projects.title: BLDC motor based servo actuator position control using FPGA

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description: Using deep learning, predicting whether a banknote is authentic or not. Developed a neural network model using TensorFlow in python to verify the given banknote is authentic or not.
projects.title: Banknote authentication using DNN: Using deep learning, predicting whether a bank note is authentic or not

member.occupation: SoC Functional Validation Engineer @ Intel Corporation

projects.description: Developed a model that accepts the currency as input in any sequence from the customer and delivers the product and balance in denominations of 5/10/25 coins. The Altera DE10 lite FPGA board is used for the implementation. The same code is verified using UVM modules which include driver/monitors/scoreboards/sequencers etc.
projects.title: Design  of Vending Machine system using System Verilog and Verification using UVM
